rezonateR 0.1.1.0000
  • Reference
  • Articles
    • An introduction to rezonateR 0.1.0

    Perform a left join on two rez data.frames and change field access status.

    rez_left_join.Rd

    This is a wrapper for performing left joins on Rez data.frames. It only changes the data frame, such as by changing field access values, at the moment. If your desired fieldaccess value is flex, this may serve as a drop-in replacement for mutate. Note that apart from the data.frame to be modified and the data.frame you are joining from, all arguments of left_join must be named.

    rez_left_join(
  df1,
  df2 = NULL,
  ...,
  fieldaccess = "foreign",
  df2Address = "",
  df2key = "",
  fkey = "",
  rezrObj = NULL
)

    Arguments

    df1

    The left data.frame.

    df2

    The right data.frame.

    ...

    Other functions passed onto left_join, i.e. the columns you will be changing or adding.

    fieldaccess

    The field access status of the field you're addding, either a single character (to apply to all of the new fields) or a vector of characters for each new field. Note that if you are both modifying and adding fields, only the added fields will have access values changed. So if you're specifying an entire vector of field access values, the best practice in using this function is to separate new-field and added-field mutates, otherwise the code will be difficult to read.

    df2Address

    The address to the source rezrDF.

    fkey

    The foreign key to the df2. If not present, I'll guess with the by-line.

    rezrObj

    The rezrObj object.

    Value

    resultDF

    Details

    By default, if no suffix is specified, the suffixes are c("", "_lower"). That is, if you are joining two data.frames, both with a column called 'name', then the left data.frame's column will still be called 'name' in the new data.frame but the right data.frame's column will get called 'name_lower'.

    Contents
